caption: Illustrates the Average Confidence Score (ACS) for unlabeled data across tasks. The ACS calculated by taking average of maximum probability confidence scores from all the unlabeled data, at the end of training. The observed decaying trend indicates that using a fixed high threshold in SS-CIL may not be suitable for effective utilization of unlabeled data in feature learning. Due to the fixed threshold, the amount of unlabeled data utilized for training is significantly reduced as tasks progresses.
raw_output:
The image shows a comparison of the Average Confidence Score (ACS) for unlabeled data across tasks for two datasets: CIFAR10 and CIFAR100. Below is the LaTeX code using the TikZ package to recreate the plot:

```latex
\documentclass[tikz,border=3.14mm]{standalone}
\usetikzlibrary{datavisualization}
\usetikzlibrary{datavisualization.formats.functions}

\begin{document}
\tikzdatavisualization%
  [set visual engine to classic,%
   all axes={scale all objects=0.7},%
   label of axis={text={Tasks}},%
   visualize as line=all,%
   label of value axis={text={ACS}},%
   value axis={minimum value=0.6, maximum value=1},%
   all charts={axis/.append style={grid=minor}}%
  ]
  
  % CIFAR10
  data[set=all] {
      X, ACS
      1, 0.94
      2, 0.84
      3, 0.80
      4, 0.81
      5, 0.61
  }
  
  info[label={a.) CIFAR10} ] at (visualization cs: x=1, y=1.1) {}
  
  % CIFAR100
  data[set=all] {
      X, ACS
      2, 0.92
      4, 0.80
      6, 0.67
      8, 0.66
      10, 0.60
  }
  
  info[label={b.) CIFAR100} ] at (visualization cs: x=6, y=1.1) {};
\end{tikzpicture}
\end{document}
```

### Explanation:
- **`\tikzdatavisualization`**: This command sets up the visualization environment.
- **`set visual engine to classic`**: Ensures a classic style for the chart.
- **`all axes={scale all objects=0.7}`**: Scales all objects to 70% of their original size.
- **`label of axis={text={Tasks}}`**: Labels the x-axis as "Tasks".
- **`visualize as line=all`**: Specifies that all datasets should be visualized as lines.
- **`label of value axis={text={ACS}}`**: Labels the y-axis as "ACS".
- **`value axis={minimum value=0.6, maximum value=1}`**: Sets the range for the y-axis from 0.6 to 1.
- **`all charts={axis/.append style={grid=minor}}`**: Enables minor grid lines for all axes.

Each dataset (CIFAR10 and CIFAR100) is defined using the `data` command, specifying the `X` and `ACS` values. Labels are added at specific coordinates to indicate which chart corresponds to which dataset.
